014/**
015 * Used to outline the various debugging levels that could be utilized within the logging layer.
016 *
017 * @since 0.1.2.0
018 * @author creatorfromhell
019 */
020public enum DebugLevel {
021  /**
022   * Off debug level. This disables debug mode.
023   */
024  OFF((byte)0, "Off"),
025  /**
026   * Standard debug level. This should include any inform calls and any error calls containing exceptions.
027   */
028  STANDARD((byte)1, "Standard"),
029
030  /**
031   * Detailed debug level. This should contain more detailed error calls and debug calls.
032   */
033  DETAILED((byte)2, "Detailed"),
034
035  /**
036   * Developer debug level. This should contain all calls.
037   */
038  DEVELOPER((byte)3, "Developer");
039
040  private byte priority;
041  private String identifier;
042
043  DebugLevel(byte priority, String identifier) {
044    this.priority = priority;
045    this.identifier = identifier;
046  }
047
048  public boolean compare(DebugLevel compare) {
049    return priority <= compare.priority;
050  }
051
052  public byte getPriority() {
053    return priority;
054  }
055
056  public void setPriority(byte priority) {
057    this.priority = priority;
058  }
059
060  public String getIdentifier() {
061    return identifier;
062  }
063
064  public static DebugLevel fromID(final String identifier) {
065    for(DebugLevel level : values()) {
066      if(level.identifier.equalsIgnoreCase(identifier)) return level;
067    }
068    return STANDARD;
069  }
070
071  public void setIdentifier(String identifier) {
072    this.identifier = identifier;
073  }
074}
